content.title: Gross Domestic Product
key_points: Core concept of Gross Domestic Product
content.statement: Gross Domestic Product (GDP) is the total monetary or market value of all finished goods and services produced within a country's borders in a specific time period.

explanation.intuition: GDP measures the size and health of an economy by summing up all the value added by everyone in the country. Think of it as the total income or output of a nation.
explanation.key_insight: GDP can be calculated three ways: production (sum of value added), income (sum of all incomes), and expenditure (sum of all spending). All three should be equal.
explanation.technical_details: GDP = C + I + G + (X - M), where C = consumption, I = investment, G = government spending, X = exports, M = imports.

citations.source: Mankiw, N.G. (2021). Principles of Economics, 9th ed. Cengage Learning.
Bureau of Economic Analysis. (2024). GDP: National Income and Product Accounts.
